snippet: Lawyers claim they are receiving many phone calls from potential litigants over faulty car ignition switches.
abstract: Lawyers across country, preparing to undertake suits against General Motors following recall of 1.6 million vehicles, say some cases could hinge on extraordinary accusations of fraud and novel legal strategies that question the very existence of the company; incidents that occurred before 2009 could call into question restructuring agreement credited with saving automaker from dissolution, potentially sending General Motors back to bankruptcy court.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers claim they are receiving many phone calls from potential litigants over faulty car ignition switches.

headline.main: Lawyers Prepare for G.M. Suits With Novel Strategies
